005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
010
011/**
012 * A subclass of {@link GenericHID} with {@link Trigger} factories for command-based.
013 *
014 * @see GenericHID
015 */
016public class CommandGenericHID extends GenericHID {
017  /**
018   * Construct an instance of a device.
019   *
020   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the device is plugged into.
021   */
022  public CommandGenericHID(int port) {
023    super(port);
024  }
025
026  @Override
027  public Trigger button(int button, EventLoop loop) {
028    return super.button(button, loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Constructs an event instance around this button's digital signal.
033   *
034   * @param button the button index
035   * @return an event instance representing the button's digital signal attached to the {@link
036   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
037   * @see #button(int, EventLoop)
038   */
039  public Trigger button(int button) {
040    return button(button, CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
041  }
042}
